channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Black bags left outside 175 cator street, 4th July
item.description:
Hi there, a number of black bags have been flytipped outside 171 Cator st and a bin on the pavement. These have appeared since yesterday. it would be great if this could be investigated and hopefully cleared up. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cator Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leaking for 10 days now, 4th July
item.description:
Water is coming out of tarmac

item.title: Large bin outside No. 4, 4th July
item.description:
Large bin was left outside number 4 Worbeck Road by the bin men about 4 weeks ago. The bin is still there and some people have thrown their rubbish in it. Please can this bin be removed. It is the one with no lid on it Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worbeck Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 4th July
item.description:
Flytipping outside 5/7 and 10/12 Three Corners. They have young children and items include a car seat and slide as well as a fridge and may not understand that putting items out on the pavement is Flytipping but this is happening more often and other people are starting to do this. We like our Road and want it to stay a nice road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18;20, Three Corners, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing out of pavement and road in the pantiles, 4th July
item.description:
This has reported previously and 2 men have come out today and have just up and down the road picked a couple with there hands and walked off, The road and streets needs to be cleared of these large weeds. outside 36 is worse than others. prev ref number- 7718382.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Pantiles, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping - Bristow road, 4th July
item.description:
Someone flytipped 2 black bags of rubbish by the bin in Bristow Road (pickford end) The foxes ripped the bags open and scattered the contents over the pavement and grsssxsrea including one of the black bags . One black bag has been collected but all the flytipped rubbish has been left all over the grass area and the road and pavement area . This is a disgusting mess and as it is clearly part of the flytipping Can this be removed and the area properly cleared up Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bristow Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report of Open Fire & Illegal Occupation at 16 Orsman Road, 4th July
item.description:
I’d like to report 16 Orsman Road residents lighting open fires on land by the canal that does not belong to them. It’s densely wooded and right next to residential buildings. This poses a serious fire risk and may be illegal land use.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Orsman Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents using cones to reserve parking space, 4th July
item.description:
No 66 have been using Parking cones for a very long time to reserve space, on a street with limited parking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Inverine Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Dead fox in front garden, 4th July
item.description:

item.title: The road has so many deep pot holes , 4 plus, 4th July
item.description:
The road has been repaired numerous times over the past my myself , and many of my neighbours , the tarmac has worn. Away wear it meets the kerb , deep holes that my wheels crash over every time I drive up the road , council send someone with a bucket if tarmac that falls out the next day , the problem is now wise then ever , and dangerous for motorcycles, if it had been fixed correctly it would not be in the state you see in the pics taken today

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cavendish Avenue, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeon Droppings, 4th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Pembridge Road, Notting Hill, London

item.title: Pile of leaves inside bike hangar, 4th July
item.description:
Hi! There are a lot of leaves ( a big pile ) inside the bike hangar F066 opposite the Moby Dick pub. Thank you very much for your help with this. Kind regards, Katre Foden

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Quay, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Tree outside 23 Brixham Road, 4th July
item.description:
Have reported this tree to you but you’ve closed report with no action. This tree is a nuisance with berries all over pavement street and pavement need sweeping asap to clear footpath. Tree needs pruning back and street to be regularly swept which it isn’t as it’s constantly sheds everywhere including driveways.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixham Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowing shrubs and trees- gertrude road, 4th July
item.description:
There is a small green area at the back of 58 gertrude road, these are causing an issue at the back of peoples gardens, can the trees and shrubs please be cut back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stickland Road, Lower Belvedere, London
